intro: Tiquilia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellow, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Tiquilia palmeri is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
